contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox person |name = Luís Fróis |image = |image_size = 200px |caption = Portuguese 200 Escudos honoring Luis Frois, (1997) |birth_date = {{Birth-date|1532}} |birth_place = [[Lisbon]], [[Kingdom of Portugal]] |death_date = {{Death-date|1597}} |death_place = |occupation = Portuguese Missionary, writer |spouse = |parents = |children = }} '''Luís Fróis''' (1532 – July 8, 1597) was a [[Portuguese people|Portuguese]] [[missionary]]. He was born in [[Lisbon]] and in 1548 joined the [[Society of Jesus]] (Jesuits). In 1563, he came to [[Japan]] to engage in missionary work, and in the following year arrived in [[Kyoto]], meeting [[Ashikaga Yoshiteru]] who was then [[Shogun]]. In 1569, he befriended [[Oda Nobunaga]] and stayed in his personal residence in [[Gifu, Gifu|Gifu]] while writing books for a short while. [[File:Nihonshi.jpg|thumb|''Nihonshi'', manuscript page.]] His writings include the ''[[History of Japan (book)|History of Japan]]''. ==See also== *[[Francis Xavier]] *[[Francisco Cabral]] *[[Alessandro Valignano]] {{Authority control|VIAF=44369221}} <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]] --> {{Persondata |NAME= Fróis, Luís |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION= Portuguese Missionary |DATE OF BIRTH= 1532 |PLACE OF BIRTH= |DATE OF DEATH= July 8, 1597 |PLACE OF DEATH= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Frois, Luis}} [[Category:1532 births]] [[Category:1597 deaths]] [[Category:Portuguese Jesuits]] [[Category:Portuguese writers]] [[Category:Portuguese Roman Catholics]] [[Category:Christian missionaries in Japan]] [[Category:Japanologists]] [[Category:16th-century writers]] [[Category:Portuguese Renaissance writers]] [[Category:Portuguese travel writers]] [[Category:Portuguese expatriates in Japan]] [[Category:Jesuit Asia missions]] [[Category:People from Lisbon]] [[Category:16th-century Portuguese people]] {{Portugal-bio-stub}} {{Portugal-writer-stub}} {{RC-clergy-stub}}
